intro: Lithocarpus chrysocomus, commonly known as the golden cupuaçu, is a species of evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Fagaceae, which includes oaks and beeches, and is characterized by its hard, woody fruit. The plant produces a unique fruit that is encased in a thick, leathery shell, which contains a single edible seed. Lithocarpus chrysocomus is often found in tropical rainforests, growing in shaded understory conditions. Its botanical features make it an important component of the ecological diversity in its native habitats.
